summary: A woman explains how to travel the world on a budget, emphasizing free accommodation through platforms like Trusted House Sitters and World Packers. She states that she is 24 years old and a full-time traveler who has visited over 50 countries on an extreme budget. She aims to share this information for free, stating that travelers helping travelers learn new things. She mentions that she did not have the money for a masterclass costing $200 and would rather spend it on a flight. She believes everyone should be able to see the world regardless of wealth status. She advises viewers to save the video for planning future trips and mentions she is talking about an extreme budget, with the first step being to secure free accommodation. She acknowledges that time is running short and will post a part two.
on_screen_text: IF YOURE BROKE BUT YOU WANT TO TRAVEL THE WORLD
Save this video to look back at to plan your trip!
transcript: if you're broke but you really wanna travel the world listen up my name is Maddie I'm 24 and I'm a full time traveler who spent over 50 countries traveling on an extreme budget and I'm gonna show you how you can do that too and no I don't have a sugar daddy no I don't have a trust fund but instead I just really know how to make my money stretch the furthest and you know I'm gonna give you all this information here on TikTok for free because when I was first getting into traveling and I had no money Travelers help travelers learn new things I definitely didn't have enough money to pay $200 for a master class I wanted to spend that on a flight and I believe everyone should be able to see the world make sure you save this video for when you want to plan your next trip now I'm talking extreme budget STEP ONE: land FREE accommodation the first thing we're gonna get sorted is your accommodation we want that to be free yes free I know but you can do this by signing up for websites like Trusted House Sitters and World Packers to either do work exchanges or watch someone's home while they're out of town this completely wipes out your number one biggest expense okay didn't realize how short I was running on time so I'll make a part 2 and post it right away
